shortDescription: short Stratum description
longDescription: long stratum description

shortDescription: LVEF prescribed beta-blocker therapy
longDescription: Percentage of patients with a diagnosis of CAD or history of cardiac surgery who have a current or prior LVEF < 40% who were prescribed beta-blocker therapy

shortDescription: Prior MI prescribed beta-blocker therapy
longDescription: Percentage of patients with a diagnosis of CAD or history of cardiac surgery who have a prior (within the past 3 years) myocardial infarction who were prescribed beta-blocker therapy

shortDescription: Patients who have received antidepressant medication for at least 84 days (12 weeks) of continuous treatment during the 114-day period following the Index Prescription Start Date
longDescription: Patients who have received antidepressant medication for at least 84 days (12 weeks) of continuous treatment during the 114-day period following the Index Prescription Start Date

shortDescription: Patients who have received antidepressant medications for at least 180 days (6 months) of continuous treatment during the 231-day period following the Index Prescription Start Date
longDescription: Patients who have received antidepressant medications for at least 180 days (6 months) of continuous treatment during the 231-day period following the Index Prescription Start Date

shortDescription: Med Rec 18 - 64 years and older
longDescription: Medication Reconciliation Post-Discharge: 18-64 years of age

shortDescription: Med Rec 65 years and older
longDescription: Medication Reconciliation Post-Discharge: 65 years and older

shortDescription: Med Rec all patients 18 years and older
longDescription: Medication Reconciliation Post-Discharge:All patients 18 years of age and older

shortDescription: Visits with blood pressure results < 140/90 mmHg
longDescription: Percentage of patient visits with blood pressure results < 140/90 mmHg

shortDescription: Visits with blood pressure results >= 140/90 mmHg and plan of care
longDescription: Percentage of patient visits with blood pressure results >= 140/90 mmHg and plan of care

shortDescription: Overall visits with blood pressure results < 140/90 mmHg and >= 140/90 mmHg with a documented plan of care
longDescription: Overall percentage of patient visits with blood pressure results < 140/90 mmHg and >= 140/90 mmHg with a documented plan of care

shortDescription: Patients who were prescribed Pneumocystis jiroveci pneumonia (PCP) prophylaxis within 3 months of CD4 count below 200 cells/mm3
longDescription: Patients who were prescribed Pneumocystis jiroveci pneumonia (PCP) prophylaxis within 3 months of CD4 count below 200 cells/mm3

shortDescription: Patients who were prescribed Pneumocystis jiroveci pneumonia (PCP) prophylaxis within 3 months of CD4 count below 500 cells/mm3 or a CD4 percentage below 15%
longDescription: Patients who were prescribed Pneumocystis jiroveci pneumonia (PCP) prophylaxis within 3 months of CD4 count below 500 cells/mm3 or a CD4 percentage below 15%

shortDescription: Patients who were prescribed Pneumocystis jiroveci pneumonia (PCP) prophylaxis at the time of diagnosis of HIV
longDescription: Patients who were prescribed Pneumocystis jiroveci pneumonia (PCP) prophylaxis at the time of diagnosis of HIV

shortDescription: Patients screened for tobacco use one or more times
longDescription: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older who were screened for tobacco use one or more times within 24 months

shortDescription: Patients screened for tobacco use one or more times and received cessation
longDescription: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older who were screened for tobacco use one or more times within 24 months AND who received tobacco cessation intervention if identified as a tobacco user

shortDescription: Screened for tobacco, identified as tobacco user that received cessation.
longDescription: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older who were screened for tobacco use and identified as a tobacco user who received tobacco cessation intervention

shortDescription: Ordered at least one high-risk
longDescription: Percentage of patients who were ordered at least one high-risk medication

shortDescription: Ordered at least two high-risk
longDescription: Percentage of patients who were ordered at least two of the same high-risk medication

shortDescription: Patients who had a height, weight and body mass index (BMI) percentile recorded during the measurement period
longDescription: Patients who had a height, weight and body mass index (BMI) percentile recorded during the measurement period

shortDescription: Patients who had counseling for nutrition during a visit that occurs during the measurement period
longDescription: Patients who had counseling for nutrition during a visit that occurs during the measurement period

shortDescription: Patients who had counseling for physical activity during a visit that occurs during the measurement period
longDescription: Patients who had counseling for physical activity during a visit that occurs during the measurement period

shortDescription: Patients who initiated treatment within 14 days of the diagnosis
longDescription: Patients who initiated treatment within 14 days of the diagnosis

shortDescription: Patients who initiated treatment and who had two or more additional services with an AOD diagnosis within 30 days of the initiation visit
longDescription: Patients who initiated treatment and who had two or more additional services with an AOD diagnosis within 30 days of the initiation visit

shortDescription: Implantable Cardioverter-Defibrillator complications or mortality at 30 days
longDescription: Complications or mortality at 30 days

shortDescription: Implantable Cardioverter-Defibrillator complications at 90 day
longDescription: Complications at 90 days

shortDescription: Percentage of children who had one follow-up visit with a practitioner with prescribing authority during the 30-Day Initiation Phase.
longDescription: Percentage of children who had one follow-up visit with a practitioner with prescribing authority during the 30-Day Initiation Phase.

shortDescription: Percentage of children who remained on ADHD medication for at least 210 days and who, in addition to the visit in the Initiation Phase, had at least two additional follow-up visits with a practitioner within 270 days (9 months) after the Initiation Phase ended.
longDescription: Percentage of children who remained on ADHD medication for at least 210 days and who, in addition to the visit in the Initiation Phase, had at least two additional follow-up visits with a practitioner within 270 days (9 months) after the Initiation Phase ended.

shortDescription: Office visit, Psych visit, or Face to Face Interaction (No ED) within 4 months of the end of the measurement period that leads to a diagnosis of major depression including remission or dysthymia
longDescription: Office visit, Psych visit, or Face to Face Interaction (No ED) within 4 months of the end of the measurement period that leads to a diagnosis of major depression including remission or dysthymia

shortDescription: Office visit, Psych visit, or Face to Face Interaction (No ED) between 4 and 8 months after the start of the measurement period that leads to a diagnosis of major depression including remission or dysthymia
longDescription: Office visit, Psych visit, or Face to Face Interaction (No ED) between 4 and 8 months after the start of the measurement period that leads to a diagnosis of major depression including remission or dysthymia

shortDescription: Office visit, Psych visit, or Face to Face Interaction (No ED) within 4 months of the start of the measurement period that leads to a diagnosis of major depression including remission or dysthymia
longDescription: Office visit, Psych visit, or Face to Face Interaction (No ED) within 4 months of the start of the measurement period that leads to a diagnosis of major depression including remission or dysthymia

shortDescription: Discharges received follow up 30 days
longDescription: The percentage of discharges for which the patient received follow-up within 30 days after discharge

shortDescription: Discharges received follow up 7 days
longDescription: The percentage of discharges for which the patient received follow-up within 7 days after discharge

shortDescription: Cardiac tamponade/pericardiocentesis females 18-64 years
longDescription: Females 18-64 years of age

shortDescription: Cardiac tamponade/pericardiocentesis males 18-64 years
longDescription: Males 18-64 years of age

shortDescription: Cardiac tamponade/pericardiocentesis females 65 years and older
longDescription: Females 65 years of age and older

shortDescription: Cardiac tamponade/pericardiocentesis males 65 years and older
longDescription: Males 65 years of age and older

shortDescription: Overall cardiac tamponade/pericardiocentesis female and males 18 years and older
longDescription: Overall percentage of patients with cardiac tamponade and/or pericardiocentesis occurring within 30 days

shortDescription: One dose of meningococcal vaccine
longDescription: Patients who had one dose of meningococcal vaccine on or between the patient's 11th and 13th birthdays

shortDescription: One tetanus, diphtheria toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine
longDescription: Patients who had one tetanus, diphtheria toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine (Tdap) on or between the patient's 10th and 13th birthdays

shortDescription: Completed the HPV vaccine
longDescription: Patients who have completed the HPV vaccine with defferent dates of service on or between the patient's 9th and 13th birthdays

shortDescription: Compliant for Meningococcal, Tdap and HPV
longDescription: All patients who are compliant for Meningococcal, Tdap and HPV during the specified timeframes

shortDescription: 5-50 years well-controlled asthma, without elevated risk of exacerbation
longDescription: Overall Percentage for patients (aged 5-50 years) with well-controlled asthma, without elevated risk of exacerbation

shortDescription: 5-17 years well-controlled asthma, without elevated risk of exacerbation
longDescription: Percentage of pediatric patients (aged 5-17 years) with well-controlled asthma, without elevated risk of exacerbation.

shortDescription: 18-50 years well-controlled asthma, without elevated risk of exacerbation
longDescription: Percentage of adult patients (aged 18-50 years) with well-controlled asthma, without elevated risk of exacerbation

shortDescription: 5 to 17 asthma well-controlled specified asthma control tool result
longDescription: Asthma well-controlled (submit the most recent specified asthma control tool result) for patients 5 to 17 with Asthma

shortDescription: 18 to 50 asthma well-controlled specified asthma control tool result
longDescription: Asthma well-controlled (submit the most recent specified asthma control tool result) for patients 18 to 50 with Asthma

shortDescription: 5 to 17 with asthma elevated risk of exacerbation
longDescription: Patient not at elevated risk of exacerbation for patients 5 to 17 with Asthma

shortDescription: 18 to 50 with asthma elevated risk of exacerbation
longDescription: Patient not at elevated risk of exacerbation for patients 18 to 50 with Asthma

shortDescription: Patients 18 years of age or older as of January 1 of the denominator identification period who had a lumbar discectomy/laminotomy procedure performed during the denominator identification period
longDescription: Percentage of patients 18 years of age or older as of January 1 of the denominator identification period who had a lumbar discectomy/laminotomy procedure performed during the denominator identification period and whose back pain was measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) within three months preoperatively AND three months (6 - 20 weeks) postoperatively.

shortDescription: Average of the change in pain preoperatively to post-operatively among patients having received a lumbar discectomy/laminotomy procedure.
longDescription: Average change (preoperative to three months (6 - 20 weeks) postoperative) in back pain for all eligible patients 18 years of age or older as of January 1 of the denominator identification period who had a lumbar discectomy/laminotomy procedure performed during the denominator identification period and whose back pain was measured by the visual analog scale (vas) within three months preoperatively and at three months (6 - 20 weeks) postoperatively

shortDescription: Patients 18 years of age or older as of January 1 of the denominator identification period who had a lumbar spine fusion procedure performed during the denominator identification period
longDescription:
Percentage of patients 18 years of age or older as of October 1 of the denominator identification
period who had a lumbar spine fusion procedure performed during the denominator identification period and whose back pain was measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) within three months preoperatively AND at one year (+/- 3 months) postoperatively.

shortDescription: Average of the change in pain preoperatively to post-operatively among patients having received a lumbar fusion.
longDescription: Average change (preoperative to one year postoperative) in back pain for all eligible patients 18 years of age or older as of October 1 of the denominator identification period who had a lumbar spine fusion procedure performed during the denominator identification period and whose back pain was measured by the visual analog scale (vas) within three months preoperatively and at one year (+/- 3 months) postoperatively

shortDescription: Patients 18 years of age or older as of January 1 of the denominator identification period who had a lumbar discectomy/laminotomy procedure performed during the denominator identification period.
longDescription:
Percentage of patients 18 years of age or older as of January 1 of the denominator identification
period who had a lumbar discectomy/laminotomy procedure performed during the denominator identification period and whose leg pain was measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) within three months preoperatively AND at three months (6 to 20 weeks) postoperatively.

shortDescription: Average of the change in pain preoperatively to postoperatively among patients having received a lumbar discectomy/laminotomy.
longDescription: Average change (preoperative to three months (6 to 20 weeks) postoperative) in leg pain for all eligible patients 18 years of age or older as of January 1 of the denominator identification period who had a lumbar discectomy/laminectomy procedure performed during the denominator identification period and whose leg pain was measured by the visual analog scale (vas) within three months preoperatively and at three months (6 to 20 weeks) postoperatively

shortDescription: Birth to 1 year of age) who were screened for risk of developmental, behavioral and social delays using a standardized tool
longDescription: Children in the eligible population who turned 1 during the performance period. (Birth to 1 year of age) who were screened for risk of developmental, behavioral and social delays using a standardized tool with interpretation and report within 12 months preceding or on their birthday

shortDescription: Children >1 to 2 who were screened for risk of developmental, behavioral and social delays using a standardized tool
longDescription: Children in the eligible population who turned 2 during the performance period (> 1 year to 2 years of age) who were screened for risk of developmental, behavioral and social delays using a standardized tool with interpretation and report within 12 months preceding or on their birthday

shortDescription: Children >2 to 3 who were screened for risk of developmental, behavioral and social delays using a standardized tool
longDescription: Children in the eligible population who turned 3 during the performance period ( > 2 years to 3 years of age) who were screened for risk of developmental, behavioral and social delays using a standardized tool with interpretation and report within 12 months preceding or on their birthday

shortDescription: Total Performance Rate based on all children who turned 1, 2, or 3 during the performance period who were screened for risk of developmental, behavioral and social delays using a standardized tool with interpretation and report within 12 months preceding or on their birthday, i.e., the sum of denominators 1, 2, and 3.
longDescription: Total Performance Rate based on all children who turned 1, 2, or 3 during the performance period who were screened for risk of developmental, behavioral and social delays using a standardized tool with interpretation and report within 12 months preceding or on their birthday, i.e., the sum of denominators 1, 2, and 3.
